div.p: V93/3407, unit 731, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. See also M to T. Wilson, 26 April 1893. Estimates of Expenditure for 1893/4

border-top: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

cell.p:
Government Botanist
This is marked with an asteriskreferring to a note by Luehmannlower on the page: 'Provides office-roomsand pays for all Contingencies'.At the time of the financial crisis began in 1892 M reported, in M to A. McLean, 7 June 1892, that he had made 'arrangements to devote the difference between my
S alary and the
sum , which would be a pension, to the payment of all contingencies beyond the allowed £400 ' .

cell.p:
1st Herbarium Assistant
This is marked with two asterisksreferring to a note by Luehmannlower on the page: 'Awaiting transfer to an other Department'.

cell.style: border-top: none; border-left: 0.0104in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0104in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p:
239
This is marked with a cross and annotated in an unknown hand: 'Since reduced by £30 by P. S. Board [Public Service Board]'.
